sentences.en: Before the hunter could take aim , the deer jumped out of sight.
sentences.cn: 在猎手瞄准前, 鹿已经逃了.

sentences.en: Crops can be all too easily decimated by unchecked depredations by deer.
sentences.cn: 任由鹿糟蹋会很容易把庄稼都毁了。

sentences.en: Deer hunting was banned in Scotland in 1959.
sentences.cn: 猎鹿于1959年在苏格兰被禁止。

sentences.en: He pointed the telescope at a deer on the hillside.
sentences.cn: 他把望远镜对着山坡上的一只小鹿.

sentences.en: He spent the weekend stalking deer in the Scottish highlands.
sentences.cn: 他周末在苏格兰高地追踪鹿的行踪.

sentences.en: It's going to be the death knell of the red deer.
Observant walkers may see red deer along this stretch of the road.
sentences.cn: 观察敏锐的步行者可能在这一路段看到赤鹿。

sentences.en: The breaking of a branch under my foot alarmed the deer.
sentences.cn: 我踩断了一根树枝,把那头鹿吓惊了.

sentences.en: The deer in the forest are all dying off from disease.
sentences.cn: 森林中的鹿一只接一只地病死了.

sentences.en: The deer spooked at any disturbance.
sentences.cn: 稍有动静，鹿就会受到惊吓。

sentences.en: The dog fleshed his fangs in the deer's leg.
The hound found the place where the deer lodged.
sentences.cn: 猎狗找到了那头鹿躲藏过的地方。

sentences.en: The hunter hit at a deer with his gun.
The hunter's rifle cracked and the deer fell dead.
sentences.cn: 猎人枪一响,鹿应声倒地死去.

sentences.en: The lions in this area prey on deer and other wild animals.
sentences.cn: 这个地方的狮子捕食鹿和其他野生动物。

sentences.en: We drove through a somewhat moth-eaten deer park.
sentences.cn: 我们驾车穿过有些破旧的鹿苑。

sentences.en: When the deer saw the hunter, it made off at once.
sentences.cn: 鹿一见到猎人, 就立刻跑掉了.

phrases.tran_cn: 鹿园；迪尔派克（美国纽约州东南部城镇）

trans.tran_en: a large wild animal that can run very fast, eats grass, and has horns
